Description: ResMed Corp., a manufacturer of durable medical equipment for sleep apnea and other sleep-related disorders, agreed to pay more than $37.5 million to resolve allegations under the False Claims Act for paying kickbacks to suppliers, sleep labs, and other health care providers.

ResMed Corp., a manufacturer of durable medical equipment for sleep apnea and other sleep-related disorders, agreed to pay $4.47 million to resolve multistate litigation alleging that it paid kickbacks to suppliers, sleep labs, and other health care providers. This was part of a larger $37.5 million settlement also involving the federal government (see separate entry).
